meanings.sent1: The winteriest day of the year brought heavy snowfall.
meanings.sent2: The snow-covered landscape looked its winteriest in January.
meanings.sent3: The snowman's hat was the winteriest thing about him.
meanings.sent4: Her icy stare was the winteriest expression I had ever seen.
meanings.sent5: The winteriest scene in the movie was when the characters ice-skated on the frozen lake.

meanings.sent1: The winteriest clothes in her wardrobe were the thick wool sweaters.
meanings.sent2: The winteriest months in this region are December and January.
meanings.sent3: The snowman's carrot nose was the winteriest feature on his face.
meanings.sent4: The winteriest silence fell over the forest as the snow began to fall.
meanings.sent5: The winteriest smell in the air was that of burning wood from the fireplace.

meanings.sent1: The winteriest wind howled outside, making the windows rattle.
meanings.sent2: Her winteriest memories were of building snowmen with her siblings.
meanings.sent3: The snow globe on her desk was the winteriest decoration in the room.
meanings.sent4: The winteriest chill crept into the room through the cracks in the window.
meanings.sent5: The winteriest feeling washed over her as she watched the snowflakes dance outside.
